topic.title: Rendering Special Images with Java Advanced Imaging (JAI) Plugin

keywords.indexterm: XML documentsAuthor Mode editingImage renderingJAI images

body.p: Certain special image types can be rendered in by using a Java Advanced Imaging (JAI) Image I/O Tools plugin.

section.title: How to Install JAI Image I/O Tools Plugin
section.p:
To install this plug, follow this procedure:
Start and open the Help About dialog box. Click the Installation Details button, go to the Configuration tab,Go to the System properties tab and look for the java.runtime.name and java.home properties. Keep their values for later use.
Download the JAI Image I/O kit corresponding to your operating system and Java distribution (found in the java.runtime.name property). A list of archived JAI distributions can be found at: .The JAI API is not the same thing as JAI Image I/O. Make sure you have installed the latter.
Run the installer. When the installation wizard displays the Choose Destination Location page, fill-in the Destination Folder field with the value of the java.home property. Continue with the installation procedure and follow the on-screen instructions.

section.title: OS X Workaround
section.p: There is no native implementation of the JAI Image I/O Tools plugin for OS X 10.5 and later. However, it has a Java implementation fallback that also works on OS X. Some of the image formats are not fully supported in this fallback mode, but at least the TIFF image format is known to be supported.

Use the following procedure for this OS X workaround:
Download a Linux (tar.gz) distribution of the JAI Image I/O Tools plugin. A list of archived JAI distributions can be found at: .
In the /lib directory, create a directory named endorsed (/lib/endorsed).
Unpack the tar.gz. Copy the clibwrapper_jiio.jar and jai_imageio.jar files from its lib directory and paste them in the /lib/endorsed directory.
Restart the application and the JAI Image I/O support will be up and running.
